Bulletin 84 EI 1560 Recommended Practice December 2015 
 
Purpose 
The purpose of this information bulletin is to raise 
awareness amongst hydrant owners, operators and 
users of the EI Publication: Recommended practice 
for the operation, inspection, maintenance and 
commissioning of aviation fuel hydrant systems and 
hydrant system extensions, First Edition 
 
Background 
The first edition, published in February 2013, was 
developed by the Energy Institute with input from 
JIG Member representatives. The intent was to 
prepare a new publication to include all the 
requirements and good practice related to the 
commissioning, 
operation, 
inspection 
& 
maintenance of hydrant systems. 
 
 
EI 1560 Recommended Practice and the JIG 2 Standard 
The operation and inspection content of EI 1560 is closely aligned with the requirements contained in 
the JIG 2 Standard and is considered to be no more onerous. However, EI 1560 also provides 
guidance and recommendations on additional topics and is a key source of information for all hydrant 
owners and operators. 
 
EI 1560 recognises that most hydrant systems have been in operation for a number of years. As

A more detailed bulletin outlining the required actions for hydrant operators to meet the requirements of 
EI 1560 and issue 12 of JIG 2 (due for publication in January 2016) will be developed by JIG during the 
first half of 2016.
